history.proof: intros H. unfold PSeries. apply Series_ext. shelve.

exceptions.exn: The LHS of PSeries_eq (PSeries _ _) does not match any subterm of the goal
The LHS of PSeries_eq (PSeries _ _) does not match any subterm of the goal
In environment a, b : nat -> R x : R H : forall n : nat, a n = b n Unable to unify "forall n : nat, a n = b n" with "forall n : nat, a n * x ^ n = b n * x ^ n".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat -> R
a: nat -> R
x: R

Goal:
(forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> PSeries a x = PSeries b x

Premises:
PSeries = fun (a : nat -> R) (x : R) => Series (fun k : nat => a k * x ^ k) : (nat -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Series_ext : forall a b : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> Series a = Series b
PSeries_1 : forall a : nat -> R, PSeries a 1 = Series a
is_pseries_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (x l : R), is_pseries a x l -> PSeries a x = l
PSeries_eq : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), PSeries a x = Series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k))
StepFun_P38 : forall (l : Rlist) (a b : R) (f : R -> R), ordered_Rlist l -> pos_Rl l 0 = a -> pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = b -> {g : StepFun a b | g b = f b /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq g (co_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (f (pos_Rl l i)))}
antiderivative = fun (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) => (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> exists pr : derivable_pt g x, f x = derive_pt g x pr) /\ a <= b : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]
sum_n_m_ext : forall (a0 b0 : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (forall n0 : nat, a0 n0 = b0 n0) -> sum_n_m a0 n m = sum_n_m b0 n m where ?G : [a : nat -> R b : nat -> R x : R |- AbelianGroup]
open_interval = fun a b x : R => a < x < b : R -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope R_scope]
co_interval = fun a b x : R => a <= x < b : R -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope R_scope]
NewtonInt_P5 : forall (f g : R -> R) (l a b : R), Newton_integrable f a b -> Newton_integrable g a b -> Newton_integrable (fun x : R => l * f x + g x) a b
Lim_seq_ext : forall u v : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> Lim_seq u = Lim_seq v
sum_Sn_m : forall (a0 : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (n <= m)%nat -> sum_n_m a0 n m = plus (a0 n) (sum_n_m a0 (S n) m) where ?G : [a : nat -> R b : nat -> R x : R |- AbelianGroup]
adapted_couple = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (l lf : Rlist) => ordered_Rlist l /\ pos_Rl l 0 = Rmin a b /\ pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = Rmax a b /\ Rlength l = S (Rlength lf) /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq f (open_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (pos_Rl lf i)) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rlist -> Rlist -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope _ _]
fe : forall a b : R, StepFun a b -> R -> R
sum_n_m_S : forall (a0 : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun n0 : nat => a0 (S n0)) n m = sum_n_m a0 (S n) (S m) where ?G : [a : nat -> R b : nat -> R x : R |- AbelianGroup]
mkStepFun : forall (a b : R) (fe : R -> R), IsStepFun fe a b -> StepFun a b
Series_incr_n_aux : forall (a : nat -> R) (n : nat), (forall k : nat, (k < n)%nat -> a k = 0) -> Series a = Series (fun k : nat => a (n + k)%nat)
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
Newton_integrable = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {g : R -> R | antiderivative f g a b \/ antiderivative f g b a} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
IsStepFun = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {l : Rlist & is_subdivision f a b l} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
is_subdivision = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (l : Rlist) => {l0 : Rlist & adapted_couple f a b l l0} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rlist -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope _]
sum_eq_R0 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> An n = 0) -> sum_f_R0 An N = 0
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Series_incr_1_aux : forall a : nat -> R, a 0%nat = 0 -> Series a = Series (fun k : nat => a (S k))
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
StepFun_P4 : forall a b c : R, IsStepFun (fct_cte c) a b
pre : forall (a b : R) (s : StepFun a b), IsStepFun s a b
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
Rabs_triang : forall a b : R, Rabs (a + b) <= Rabs a + Rabs b
PSeries_correct : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x -> is_pseries a x (PSeries a x)
Series = fun a : nat -> R => real (Lim_seq (sum_n a)) : (nat -> R) -> R Argument scope is [function_scope]
fct_cte = fun a _ : R => a : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
sum_n_m = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => Iter.iter_nat plus zero a n m : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
sum_eq : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall i : nat, (i <= N)%nat -> An i = Bn i) -> sum_f_R0 An N = sum_f_R0 Bn N

```coq
intros H.
unfold PSeries.
rewrite PSeries_eq.
rewrite PSeries_eq.
apply Series_ext.
apply H.
Qed.```

original: intros H. unfold PSeries. rewrite PSeries_eq. rewrite PSeries_eq. apply Series_ext. apply H.
